name: Ramazan Gokberk Cinbis
content: Gokberk Cinbis - Homepage GÃ¶kberk CinbiÅ Assoc. Professor METU ImageLab - Computer Vision and Machine Learning Research Lab Department of Computer Engineering Middle East Technical University (METU) Bio: I was a doctoral researcher in the LEAR (now THOTH) team, at INRIA Grenoble, France, from 2010 until 2014, where my advisors were Jakob Verbeek and Cordelia Schmid, and received a PhD degree from Université de Grenoble. I received an M.A. degree from Boston University, USA, in 2010, where my advisor was Stan Sclaroff. My research interests include data-efficient machine learning with minimal supervision (zero-shot, few-shot, weakly-supervised, self-supervised learning), generative models, learning to learn (meta learning), vision-language integration, and large-scale image/video understanding. Contact: Orta Dogu Teknik Universitesi, Department of Computer Engineering, Room B205, Ankara, Turkey. News Nov. 2025 - Bioinformatics paper: DARKIN: a zero-shot benchmark for phosphositeâdark kinase association using protein language models Jun. 2025 - New preprint: Exploring Sparsity for Parameter Efficient Fine Tuning Using Wavelets May 2025 - Paper to appear at ICML'25: Interchangeable Token Embeddings for Extendable Vocabulary and Alpha-Equivalence Apr. 2025 - Preprint: Meta-LoRA: Meta-Learning LoRA Components for Domain-Aware ID Personalization Jan. 2025 - Preprint: Interchangeable Token Embeddings for Extendable Vocabulary and Alpha-Equivalence Oct. 2024 - New paper: Utilizing Class-Agnostic Point-to-Box Regressors as Object Proposal Generators Sep. 2024 - New paper on estimating evapotranspiration (ET) without needing optical satellite data, considering cloudy conditions: SAR2ET: End-to-end SAR-driven Multisource ET Imagery Estimation Over Croplands. Sep. 2024 - New paper: Shadow-aware terrain classification: advancing hyperspectral image sensing through generative adversarial networks and correlated sample synthesis. Jun. 2024 - We are organizing the 2nd workshop on Vision-based InduStrial InspectiON (@ECCV 2024). May 2024 - I will be an area chair at BMVC 2024. Apr 2024 - Honored to be one of the recepients of Science Academy - Young Scientist Award BAGEP 2024. Feb. 2024 - New paper at Pattern Recognition: Cross-lingual few-shot sign language recognition Feb. 2024 - Paper to appear at ICLR'24 workshop MLGenX: DARKIN: A zero-shot classification benchmark and an evaluation of protein language models July 2023 - New paper to appear at ICCV 2023: HybridAugment++: Unified Frequency Spectra Perturbations for Model Robustness June 2023 - I will be an area chair at BMVC 2023. Mar. 2023 - New paper to appear at CVPR 2023: Meta-tuning Loss Functions and Data Augmentation for Few-shot Object Detection Feb. 2023 - We are organizing the 1st workshop on Vision-based InduStrial InspectiON (@CVPR 2023). Feb. 2023 - New TUBITAK project on any-shot learning for the dark phosphoproteome (PI: Dr. Oznur Tastan). Nov. 2022 - Our work on Semantics-driven Attentive Few-shot Learning over Clean and Noisy Samples will be published at Neurocomputing. July 2022 - I will be an area chair at BMVC 2022. July 2022 - StreamDEQ (Streaming Multiscale Deep Equilibrium Models) will appear at ECCV 2022. July 2022 - New paper accepted for publication at Image and Vision Computing: Caption Generation on Scenes with Seen and Unseen Object Categories. Apr. 2022 - New preprint: Streaming Multiscale Deep Equilibrium Models. Apr. 2022 - We will be a part of the "Improving Resiliency of Malian Farmers with Yield Estimation" project (together with ITU, Agcurate and OKO Finance), one of 13 projects recently funded by ClimateChange AI. Mar. 2022 - New paper published at Image and Vision Computing: How robust are discriminatively trained zero-shot learning models?. Jan. 2022 - New paper to appear at ICLR 2022: Closed-form Sample Probing for Learning Generative Models in Zero-shot Learning. Jan. 2022 - New IEEE TPAMI paper: Towards Zero-shot Sign Language Recognition. Jan. 2022 - New arXiv preprint: Semantics-driven Attentive Few-shot Learning over Clean and Noisy Samples. Jan. 2022 - Our work on drug side effect prediction is accepted for publication at IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics. Jan. 2022 - New paper to appear at IEEE/CVF WACV 2022: MaskSplit: Self-supervised Meta-learning for Few-shot Semantic Segmentation. [video] Aug. 2021 - New arXiv preprint: Detection and Captioning with Unseen Object Classes. July 2021 - I will be an area chair at BMVC 2021. April 2021 - New paper on Weakly Supervised Instance Attention for Multisource Fine-Grained Object Recognition with an Application to Tree Species Classification will be published in ISPRS Journal of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing. Sep 2020 - Our work: Red Carpet to Fight Club: Partially-supervised Domain Transfer for Face Recognition in Violent Videos will appear in WACV 2021. The dataset is available online on the project page. Aug 2020 - New paper on adversarial robustness in zero-shot learning, to appear in ECCV 2020 Workshop on Adversarial Robustness in the Real World. July 2020 - We (as METU) have been selected as a Key Innovator, jointly with two other partners, for our activities in the SnapEarth project. [details] June 2020 - I have been listed as one of the Outstanding Reviewers at CVPR 2020. June 2020 - I will give lectures at Bilim Akademisi - Bilkent University AI Summer School 2020. Apr. 2020 - New TUBITAK 1001 research project on meta-learning. Students interested in full-time scholarship positions: please email me. [project page] Mar. 2020 - Our work on collaborative model training has been accepted to Pattern Recognition. [paper] Feb. 2020 - I am honored to be one of the recipients of Google Faculty Research Awards 2019-2020! Jan. 2020 - with Prof Emre Akbas, we are offering the Deep Generative Models course in Spring 2020. Jan. 2020 - new work to appear at SPIE Medical Imaging 2020 conference: Graph convolutional networks for region of interest classification in breast histopathology. Dec. 2019 - new H2020 project SnapEarth has started. For more information: [LinkedIn] Nov. 2019 - new preprint: DeepSide: A Deep Learning Framework for Drug Side Effect Prediction Sep. 2019 - I have given seminars at VBYO and Google DeepMind. Aug. 2019 - new preprint on preventing GAN attacks in collaborative learning. [arXiv] July 2019 - Two papers to appear at BMVC'19: (i) Image Captioning with Unseen Objects, (ii) Zero-Shot Sign Language Recognition: Can Textual Data Uncover Sign Languages?. June 2019 - GMN source code is now out on Bulent's github page, with updated results: github.com/mbsariyildiz/gmn-zsl May. 2019 - New ICIP'19 paper: Learning Visually Consistent Label Embeddings for Zero-Shot Learning. Mar. 2019 - Two papers to appear at CVPR'19: (i) Gradient Matching Generative Networks for Zero-Shot Learning. (ii) Cross-task weakly supervised learning from instructional videos. Mar. 2019 - New IGARSS'19 paper: Weakly Supervised Deep Convolutional Networks For Fine-grained Object Recognition In Multispectral Images . Feb. 2019 - offering Introduction to Computer Vision and Advanced Deep Learning courses for Spring'19. Jan. 2019 - our work on Multisource Region Attention Network for Fine-Grained Object Recognition will be published in IEEE TGRS. Oct 2018 - our translation of Deep Learning book by Goodfellow et al has been published. July 2018 - visiting Inria Paris - WILLOW Team, until mid-August. July 2018 - our work on zero-shot object detection has been accepted to BMVC 2018. June 2018 - Gencer Sumbul, jointly supervised by Selim Aksoy and me, successfully defended his MSc thesis with very nice results on deep learning for remote sensing. He will continue his PhD study at TU Berlin. May 2018 - new preprint on face detection and recognition in violent scenes. [arXiv] May 2018 - new preprint on zero-shot object detection. [arXiv] Mar. 2018 - I was a panelist at BYORK Big Data and AI Workshop in Ankara. Feb. 2018 - offering Introduction to Computer Vision and Advanced Deep Learning courses for Spring'18. Sep. 2017 - joined METU as an assistant professor of computer science. Sep. 2017 - our work on zero-shot learning and fine-grained classification for remote sensing will be published in IEEE TGRS. July 2017 - one paper accepted to ICCV'17: Attributes2Classname: A discriminative model for attribute-based unsupervised zero-shot learning. June 2017 - We are organizing a summer school on artificial intelligence for high-school students. May 2017 - I will be one of the lecturers at the computer vision and robotics summer school in Ankara, organized by Hacettepe University. May 2017 - new arXiv preprint on using attributes in deep zero-shot learning of classes with unknown attributes. Dec. 2016 - Berkan Demirel, co-supervised with Nazli Ikizler-Cinbis, successfully defended his MSc thesis. Nov. 2016 - new TUBITAK CAREER research grant on learning with weak supervision. May 2016 - our SIU 2016 paper received Alper Atalay Best Student Paper Award - Third Prize. Feb. 2016 - starting as an assistant professor at Bilkent University! Jan. 2016 - new TPAMI paper: "Weakly Supervised Object Localization with Multi-fold Multiple Instance Learning". Sep. 2015 - new TPAMI paper: "Approximate Fisher Kernels of non-iid Image Models for Image Categorization". Jun. 2015 - invited talk at ORASIS 2015. Apr. 2015 - Best PhD Thesis Prize by French Association for Pattern Recognition (AFRIF). More...
